name: Viva Pharmaceutical Inc.
address: Viva Pharmaceutical Inc., 13880 Viking Pl, Richmond, BC V6V 1K8

featured_reviews.review_id: I have recently joined the company. They are really nice people and help me with any issue.
featured_reviews.review_text: I have recently joined the company. They are really nice people and help me with any issue.

featured_reviews.review_id: Came in for a job interview without appointment. Both the receptionist and the HR person treated me very well. The company seems to be mainly focused on manufacturing and production at the moment. If you have experience in these areas, go ahead and apply. They seem like good people.

featured_reviews.review_id: Got fired after 3days because I couldn't pick up work fast enough. Probably a company looks for marvel heroes who can do everything in a few days. Now I am wondering what probation period exists for. Don't even bother working here for an experience. You will learn nothing.

featured_reviews.review_translated_text:
The part-time workers have noticed that this company is very inhumane. The employees have worked hard for the company for nearly three months and have not made any mistakes. There is no problem with their ability to work. They can find any reason to fire employees. They only take advantage of legal loopholes. During the three-month probation period, employees can be fired without reason. It's legal, it's very unfair to us workers, a regulation is not a good company! It's best not to go again and change to a more humane unit! No wonder their company keeps recruiting newcomers to try out and then dismiss them, a vicious circle! Very contempt disgusting!
There is one more disgusting thing. Before entering the company, you have to have a medical examination and buy iron-toed shoes. We need to spend at least 50 for the physical examination to check for tuberculosis and get the report signed, etc., and 80 for the iron-toed shoe market. Their family paid 40 physical examinations and 70 iron-toed shoes for reimbursement. However, the reimbursement will only be granted after the probationary period has passed. So the decision is entirely in their hands. You did not make a mistake, if they want to fire you, they will fire you. And they won't reimburse you, and they will confidently say that the contract says that they will be reimbursed after the probationary period. What a shameless unit!
